overview_of_class: This class will examine the role of "debt" in Wagner's Ring, with special attention paid to "The Rhinegold." Several theoretical texts with particular relevance to this problem will also be read, including the 2nd book of Nietzsche's "Toward a Genealogy of Morals," and Walter Benjamin's discussion of the "plotter" in his study of The Origins of the German Mourning Play. As background students may want to read David Graever's historical survey and discussion of the question of "debt:" Debt: The First 5000 Years.
name: Literary Movements
title: WCAS COMP_LIT 303-0-20 Literary Movements

descriptions.value: This class will examine the role of "debt" in Wagner's Ring, with special attention paid to "The Rhinegold." Several theoretical texts with particular relevance to this problem will also be read, including the 2nd book of Nietzsche's "Toward a Genealogy of Morals," and Walter Benjamin's discussion of the "plotter" in his study of The Origins of the German Mourning Play. As background students may want to read David Graever's historical survey and discussion of the question of "debt:" Debt: The First 5000 Years.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: At the end of the class students will be expected to have a fresh understanding of the cultural significance of "debt" beyond the sphere of traditional economics, and some of its distinctively modern effects. Can or should all debts be repaid? What are the consequences when some are not? Why should the motif of debt be so important to Western modernity? These are some of the questions that will have been explored in the course of the quarter.
